    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Caligni Stalker</h1>Caligni stalkers are often leaders of caligni enclaves.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Humanoid</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=14">Society</a></u>)</b>: DC 19<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=66">Caligni Stalker</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 4</span></h1><span alt="Chaotic Neutral" class="traitalignment" title="Chaotic Neutral">CN</span><span alt="Medium" class="traitsize" title="Medium">Medium</span><span alt="Caligni Trait" class="trait" title="These subterranean people have darkvision, and some have powers to create darkness."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=210">Caligni</a></span><span alt="Humanoid Trait" class="trait" title="Humanoid creatures reason and act much like humans. They typically stand upright and have two arms and two legs."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=91">Humanoid</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 51</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +10; greater darkvision, light blindness<br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=28"><u>Caligni</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=11"><u>Undercommon</a></u><br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=1"><u>Acrobatics</a></u> +13, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=3"><u>Athletics</a></u> +8, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=15"><u>Stealth</a></u> +13, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=17"><u>Thievery</a></u> +11<br /><b>Str</b> +2, <b>Dex</b> +5, <b>Con</b> +2, <b>Int</b> -1, <b>Wis</b> +2, <b>Cha</b> +1<br /><b>Items</b> <a href="Equipment.aspx?ID=485"><u>black smear poison (6 doses)</u></a>, <a href="Armor.aspx?ID=4"><u>leather armor</u></a>, <a href="Weapons.aspx?ID=43"><u>shortsword (2)</u></a><hr /><b>AC</b> 21, <b>Fort</b> +10, <b>Ref</b> +13, <b>Will</b> +8<br /><b>HP</b> 60 (death flame)<br /><b>Death Flame</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=100">light</a>) When the stalker dies, their body combusts in a flash of white-hot flame. All creatures in a 20-foot burst take 5d6 fire damage (DC 21 basic Reflex save). The stalker’s gear and treasure are unaffected by the flames and are left in a pile where they died.<hr /><b>Speed</b> 25 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> Shortsword +13 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=179"><u>finesse</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=200"><u>versatile S</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d6+7 piercing plus <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Equipment.aspx?ID=485"><i>black smear poison</i></a></span><b>Occult Innate Spells</b> DC 19; <b>2nd</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=59">darkness</a></u></i> (at will), <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=210">obscuring mist</a></u></i> (at will); <b>Cantrips</b> <b>(2nd)</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=66">detect magic</a></u></i><br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Double Slice</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions_I.png">  The caligni stalker makes two Strikes against the same target, one with each of their shortswords. The stalker combines the damage of any attacks that hit and applies <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=340"><i>precision damage</i></a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=346"><i>resistances</i></a>, and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=345"><i>weaknesses</i></a> only once. Both attacks count toward the stalker’s multiple attack penalty, but the penalty increases only after both attacks.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Encircling Command</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=16"><u>auditory</a></u>) Each caligni creeper within 30 feet of the stalker can <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Actions.aspx?ID=87"><i>Step</i></a>. Each creeper can benefit from Encircling Command only once per round.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Sneak Attack</b> The Caligni Stalker deals 1d6 extra <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Rules.aspx?ID=340"><i>precision</i></a> damage to <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=16"><i>flat-footed</i></a> creatures.</span><h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=18">Caligni</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=65">Caligni Creeper</a></td><td>2</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=64">Caligni Dancer</a></td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=66">Caligni Stalker</a></td><td>4</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=18">Caligni</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 50</i></a><br />Calignis lurk in subterranean cities, creeping to the surface to steal, stalk, or make mischief. Each caligni serves in a specific role and grows into a specific form as determined by supernatural traditions and influences in caligni society. Regardless of their size or role, all calignis are gaunt, with pale flesh and white eyes. Some surface dwellers call the caligni “dark folk,” a term they dislike because it doesn’t reflect either their appearance or character, only their environment.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Treasure and Rewards" title="Sidebar - Treasure and Rewards" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_5_TreasureAndRewards.png"> Caligni Treasure</h3>Many calignis hide shiny
baubles and trinkets beneath
their dark rags, keeping them
out of sight of their greedy kin.
They also keep several doses of
black smear poison on hand to
incapacitate foes.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> The Caligni Legacy</h3>The calignis are descendants
of humans who, millennia ago,
fled underground to escape a
devastating cataclysm and begged
malevolent, shadowy demigods
known only as the Forsaken for
salvation. The Forsaken warped the
refugees into tough survivors, but
at a price: every caligni that dies
combusts in a burst of energy that
provides a scrap of soul energy to
the Forsaken. The greatest irony
of the caligni’s bargain is that the
Forsaken themselves mysteriously
vanished long ago and no longer
answer pleas or prayers. Today,
caligni still burst into light upon
death, but their soul energy
no longer feeds a mysterious
pantheon of shadowy divinities.</span>

    <br />

      var initializeSearch = function (search) {

          var text;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))

                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;

                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;

      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
</body>
</html>
